People really like to romanticize Half Life 2, but the problem with Half Life 2 is that it cuts out fun combat to sacrifice for graphical updates and gimmicky additions

-Vehicular sections are too long and end up becoming boring
-Striders, Gunships, and helicopters end up being a pain in the ass to fight, because they use absurdly powerful hitscan weapons, have extremely small hitboxes in the case of the strider,  and terrible level design when it comes to these boss fights
-The lack of fun and interesting enemies incentivizes the use of the same old weapons over and over, and many of the weapons are unsatisfying to use, due to sound design, accuracy, and damage dealt.
-Gimmicks are used for each level to make them unique, however I'd argue that games don't NEED gimmicks, as these gimmicks become stale very quickly. Instead, Valve should have focused on core combat mechanics and just make each level designed around combat while telling the story of the game.

Half Life 2 serves as a good museum to progress in game development and it showcases the interesting setting of City 17, however it fails to keep the core combat mechanics that made Half Life 1 fun, and if you focus more on gameplay, well let's just say you're better off playing Black Mesa or Half Life 1

La primera versión tiene una muy buena historia y es un juego recomendable 100%, en esta versión se enlaza la historia del primero con un mundo futurista lleno de sorpresas que hacen pensar en el antes y el después de esta increíble aventura. A todo esto le sumamos la notable diferencia de gráficos y calidad estética junto a la jugabilidad mejorada en esta segunda parte, y logramos una maravilla de juego.
